intro: Heterochaeta stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heterochaeta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slight serration along the edges. Heterochaeta stricta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
